html: An ensign is a standard or a pennant to be seen by others. In 2 Ne. 29:2. the latter-day ensign is identified as the words of Nephi's seed, the Book of Mormon (compare D&C 115:5, 45:9). The word "hiss" has a connotation somewhat different from the present-day meaning. In the Book of Mormon, it is used to identify the going forth of the gospel to the ends of the earth (see 2 Ne. 29:2).
